definition: editorial (in a newspaper)/also written 社論|社论
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)

sentences.english: Maybe check out some editorial reviews that you can “borrow” to make it appear that you know what you are talking about.
sentences.chinese: 也許查查社評，你可以藉此表明你知道你在說什麼。

definition: Xi Jinping (1953-), PRC politician, General Secretary of the CCP from 2012, president of the PRC from 2013
abbr. for 民主建港協進聯盟|民主建港协进联盟, Democratic alliance for the betterment of Hong Kong (DAB), Hong Kong pro-Beijing party
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
president (title of the head of state of China and several other nations)
Li Keqiang (1955-), PRC politician, prime minister from 2013
Dagong Bao, popular newspaper name/Ta Kung Pao, newspaper founded 1902 in Beijing, now published in Hong Kong
China Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC)/abbr. for 中國證券監督管理委員會|中国证券监督管理委员会
the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
